alert.note: Alert for Le Sueur; Steele; Todd; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 7:35PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ENDING THIS EVENING... ...DANGEROUSLY COLD WIND CHILLS INTO NEXT WEEK... .Powdery light snow will gradually diminish through the rest of this evening, with little to no additional snow accumulation. Northwest wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph will lead to areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility, especially across western and southern Minnesota. Meanwhile, confidence remains high that dangerously cold wind chills will follow tonight, with widespread values of 25 to 40 degrees below zero likely through early next week. A Wind Chill Warning is in effect for western and southern Minnesota tonight through Sunday morning. A Wind Chill Advisory is in effect for eastern Minnesota and western Wisconsin tonight through Sunday morning. After Sunday morning, Wind Chill Advisories continue across central and southern Minnesota through Tuesday morning as wind chill values will remain between 20 and 35 degrees below zero most of the day on Sunday and Monday. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Todd, Le Sueur, Waseca and Steele Counties. * WHEN...Until noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
